name: Merry CHRISTMAS for DiamondJim Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters from the word CHRISTMAS, find a 4-letter word meaning wealthy.
questions.explanation:
Rich.

	If you are rich, you have a lot of money.  Sometimes rich can mean very sweet, like a rich chocolate cake.

questions.text: Using only CHRISTMAS letters, find a 4-letter word for a fine spray.
questions.explanation:
Mist.

	Mist is a spray that is usually very fine.  Misters spray water to water plants or keep you cool on a hot day.

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 3-letter word for something you put on your head.
questions.explanation:
Hat.

	There are many different kinds of hats.  You can wear a visor, a baseball cap, a fez, a habit (that's what a nun wears), a beanie, or a top hat.  Abraham Lincoln is famous for wearing a top hat, which is also the kind of hat magicians pull rabbits from.

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 4-letter word for a heavenly body.
questions.explanation:
Star.

	Stars fill the night sky, especially when it is very dark, and there are not many lights on around you.  Stars can be millions of miles away and still be seen.  Although they look small, they are actually quite big, and hot too!

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 5-letter word meaning intelligent.
questions.explanation:
Smart.

	If someone is considered smart, they usually know a lot.  Sometimes someone can be called a "smart alec", which is when they are sarcastic and literal.  It means they are acting smart but in a very annoying way.  I have been known to be a smart alec.  ;-)

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 5-letter word meaning a graph.
questions.explanation:
Chart.

	Charts show all sorts of data.  A bar graph is a chart that shows numbers with bars in a row.  They can either go up and down or side to side.  A pie chart is a circle that shows data.  There are all sorts of charts, including the pie chart, bar graph, line graph, scatter plot, and stem and leaf plot.

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 3-letter word for a rodent.
questions.explanation:
Rat.

	Rats are usually considered to be dirty, smelly, ugly things that carry disease, but they can also be very nice pets.  They look like mice, but are much bigger.  Their teeth never stop growing, just like most rodents, so they are always chewing things.

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 3-letter word for a feline.
questions.explanation:
Cat.

	Cats are common house pets.  They usually sleep up to 18 hours a day, and are most active at night.  Although most people think that cats like milk, it can actually be bad for them!

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 5-letter word meaning a stick used to make a fire or a set of similar things.
questions.explanation:
Match.

	A match can be a set of two items that look alike.  For instance, if you are playing Memory, also called Concentration, if you find two cards that look alike you have found a match.  A match is also a little wooden stick with a red tip that makes fire.  Please kids, do not play with matches!  They can be dangerous.

questions.text: Using only letters from CHRISTMAS, find a 5-letter word for a month of the year.
questions.explanation:
March.

	March is the third month in the year, right after February and right before April.  This is the month where people celebrate Saint Patrick's Day.  To march can also mean to walk in a certain pattern, usually with stomping feet.
